result.execSummary:
The defendant Leroy D Newman Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Release for work, inmate work assignments, the Day Reporting Center.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  Credit for three days 4/9/2015 to 4/11/2015.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

No  use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Not to possess  cash currency in an amount greater than $250.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
May not ahve more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
No drivers license suspension imposed.

Participate in a Cognitive Behavior Program.
Fine is set at zero.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.   Successfully complete recommended treatment.  DOC must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

timeConds.notes:
Without good time credit.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  STAYED to be used as follows for  violations for possession/use of alcohol or drugs after 8/21/2015:  to serve 20 days for first violation; serve 30 days for second; 40 days for third.
*5/2/2016  Honorable Carolina M. Stark- stay lifted as to 20 days.  Order for Commitment signed/filed.

Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions, received and filed. tk 
Copies mailed to parties.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Stark
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ x  ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Defendant Leroy D Newman in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.   Paul Hauer on behalf of Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1-
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; release for work, inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 3 days (04-09-2015 to 04-11-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $250.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor. 
- Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- No drivers license suspension imposed. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 90 DAYS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  This is stayed to use as follows: 
* First violation of possession/use of alcohol or drugs after 08-21-2015 to serve 20 DAYS.
* Second violation of possession/use of alcohol or drugs after 08-21-2015 to serve 30 DAYS.
* Third violation of possession/use of alcohol or drugs after 08-21-2015 to serve 40 DAYS.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated July 28, 2015 received and filed. tk
Original Warrant in file.
All conditions remain the same.

Defendant Leroy D Newman in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Court cancelled bench warrant. Bail hearing proceed.  Arguments heard as to bail. Court admonished defendant. Court amends bail signature bond to $1000.00. Court adjourned case for sentencing hearing on 07-29-2015 at 8:30 am, Branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated July 21, 2015 received and filed. tk
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 300.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

No appearances.
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT FILE. Defendant failing to appear for violation on justice point report, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Sentencing hearing remains scheduled for 07-22-2015 at 1:30 pm.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE. Case heard on behalf of Branch 17 as Branch 17 is in jury trial. 

Case in court to address Justice Point violation; defendant since absconded. Court realized that a substitution had been filed against Branch 3, and therefore Branch 3 is not able to address the violation. Justice Point case worker was notified and will take the appropriate action.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report (positive drug test) received and filed. Defendant absconded.  Branch 3 will address the violation for Branch 17 as Branch 17 is in trial.

Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report: Missed Office Contact, received and filed. tk 
Court will address report today.
Letters on behalf of defendant received and filed. tk

Defendant Leroy D Newman in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson appearing via telephone.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court to address a Justice Point violation.  Arguments heard by the parties. Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.  Case remains scheduled for sentencing on 07/22/2015. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation (positive drug test) Report received and filed.

State placed negotiations on the record. 
As to Count 1 as amended: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court ordered any sentencing materials be submitted in writing at least 3 business days before the sentencing hearing.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 17.

Defendant Leroy D Newman in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information and waives formal reading.  
Court ordered Count 1 amended to Possession of THC (tetrahydrocannabinols)- 2nd and Subsequent Offende, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 961.41(3g)(e), 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Leroy D Newman in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Defense requesting an adjournment. For reasons placed on the record, case is adjourned for plea and sentencing, Br. 17. Any other motions are due no later than 06-17-2015 at 8:30 am. Court addresses the Justice Point received and notes Defendant continues to comply.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Calendar call scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated June 3, 2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Leroy D Newman in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson. Brandon Wigley for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Court orders case for adjourned projected Plea and Sentencing on 6-4-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Branch 17.
Any motions are due no later than 6-4-2015 at 8:30 a.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated May 1, 2015, received and filed.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Leroy D Newman in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Ronald Dague on behalf of Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated April 17, 2015 received and filed. tk
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.

Defendant Leroy D Newman in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Leroy D Newman in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
